tags.description: 1: La época medieval
2: El siglo XVI
3: El siglo XVII
4: La literatura romántica, realista y naturalista
5: La Generación del 98 y el Modernismo
6: Teatro y poesía del siglo XX
7: El Boom latinoamericano
8: Escritores contemporáneos de Estados Unidos y España

tags.label: Skill and Learning Objective
tags.description: Skill and Learning Objective

tags.label: Skill Category 1
tags.description: Skill Category 1: Analyze and/or interpret literary texts and audio sources in the target language.

tags.label: Skill 1.A
tags.description: Skill 1.A: Read/listen to and comprehend literary texts.

tags.label: 1.A.i
tags.description: 1.A.i: Paraphrase the literary text.

tags.label: 1.A.ii
tags.description: 1.A.ii: Summarize the plot of a literary text.

tags.label: 1.A.iii
tags.description: 1.A.iii: Explain literary texts using supporting details.

tags.label: Skill 1.B
tags.description: Skill 1.B: Identify the theme in a text.

tags.label: Skill 1.C
tags.description: Skill 1.C: Identify or describe literary elements, voices, and stylistic features.

tags.label: 1.C.i
tags.description: 1.C.i: Identify rhetorical figures.

tags.label: 1.C.ii
tags.description: 1.C.ii: Identify points of view.

tags.label: 1.C.iii
tags.description: 1.C.iii: Describe stylistic features (structure, setting, timeframes, characters, style, point of view, tone).

tags.label: 1.C.iv
tags.description: 1.C.iv: Make distinctions between voices in order to establish differences in meaning.

tags.label: 1.C.v
tags.description: 1.C.v: Make distinctions between narrative voices and the author's perspective in order to establish differences in meaning.

tags.label: 1.C.vi
tags.description: 1.C.vi: Make distinctions between stylistic features in order to establish differences in meaning.

tags.label: Skill 1.D
tags.description: Skill 1.D: Identify perspective, attitude, or tone.

tags.label: Skill 1.E
tags.description: Skill 1.E: Explain the function and/or the significance of rhetorical, structural, and stylistic features.

tags.label: 1.E.i
tags.description: 1.E.i: Explain the significance of points of view.

tags.label: 1.E.ii
tags.description: 1.E.ii: Explain the relationship between the structure of a text and its content.

tags.label: Skill 1.F
tags.description: Skill 1.F: Explain implied meanings or inferences.

tags.label: Skill 1.G
tags.description: Skill 1.G: Explain perspective, attitude, or tone.

tags.label: Skill 1.H
tags.description: Skill 1.H: Explain the development of a theme in a text.

tags.label: Skill 1.I
tags.description: Skill 1.I: Connect themes or ideas to characters.

tags.label: Skill Category 2
tags.description: Skill Category 2: Make connections between a literary text and a non-literary text or an aspect of culture.

tags.label: Skill 2.A
tags.description: Skill 2.A: Identify cultural products, practices, or perspectives.

tags.label: 2.A.i
tags.description: 2.A.i: Identify cultural products in texts and visuals.

tags.label: 2.A.ii
tags.description: 2.A.ii: Identify cultural practices in texts and visuals.

tags.label: 2.A.iii
tags.description: 2.A.iii: Identify cultural perspectives found in texts and visuals.

tags.label: Skill 2.B
tags.description: Skill 2.B: Explain the relationship between cultural products, practices, and perspectives of target cultures.

tags.label: 2.B.i
tags.description: 2.B.i: Explain how cultural products or practices relate to cultural perspectives in literary texts.

tags.label: 2.B.ii
tags.description: 2.B.ii: Explain how cultural beliefs and attitudes affect the interpretation of a text.

tags.label: 2.B.iii
tags.description: 2.B.iii: Explain the role of cultural stereotypes in texts.

tags.label: 2.B.iv
tags.description: 2.B.iv: Explain the relationship between a literary movement and cultural perspectives.

tags.label: Skill 2.C
tags.description: Skill 2.C: Relate target language texts to genres, periods, movements, and techniques.

tags.label: 2.C.i
tags.description: 2.C.i: Identify features of a literary genre.

tags.label: 2.C.ii
tags.description: 2.C.ii: Identify features of literary periods, movements, historical and sociocultural contexts.

tags.label: 2.C.iii
tags.description: 2.C.iii: Identify structural or rhetorical features in a text of the same period, genre or literary movement.

tags.label: 2.C.iv
tags.description: 2.C.iv: Explain how the content and stylistic features of a text relate to a genre, period, or literary movement.

tags.label: 2.C.v
tags.description: 2.C.v: Explain how features of a text are characteristic of a genre, period, or literary movement.

tags.label: 2.C.vi
tags.description: 2.C.vi: Identify the literary movement to which a text belongs.

tags.label: 2.C.vii
tags.description: 2.C.vii: Explain how literary movements reflect their cultural and historical context.

tags.label: Skill 2.D
tags.description: Skill 2.D: Situate textual language and registers within historical, social, and geopolitical contexts.

tags.label: 2.D.i
tags.description: 2.D.i: Identify examples of formal and informal language.

tags.label: 2.D.ii
tags.description: 2.D.ii: Identify use of language registers to reflect social relationships in texts.

tags.label: 2.D.iii
tags.description: 2.D.iii: Identify linguistic features representative of the time and place in which a text was written.

tags.label: 2.D.iv
tags.description: 2.D.iv: Explain the relationship between linguistic changes and historical/geopolitical contexts.

tags.label: 2.D.v
tags.description: 2.D.v: Compare textual language and registers in texts produced in different historical, social, and geopolitical contexts.

tags.label: Skill 2.E
tags.description: Skill 2.E: Relate texts to their contexts (literary, historical, sociocultural, geopolitical).

tags.label: 2.E.i
tags.description: 2.E.i: Identify information from other disciplines related to course content.

tags.label: 2.E.ii
tags.description: 2.E.ii: Explain how a text's content relates to sociocultural, geopolitical, or historical contexts.

tags.label: 2.E.iii
tags.description: 2.E.iii: Explain the relationship between a literary text and its sociocultural, geopolitical, and historical contexts.

tags.label: 2.E.iv
tags.description: 2.E.iv: Explain how behaviors and attitudes present in texts reflect sociocultural geopolitical, and historical contexts.

tags.label: Skill 2.F
tags.description: Skill 2.F: Relate texts to contemporary global issues.

tags.label: 2.F.i
tags.description: 2.F.i: Identify themes in a literary text that are relevant to contemporary society.

tags.label: 2.F.ii
tags.description: 2.F.ii: Explain the relationship between themes found in literary texts and contemporary or global issues.

tags.label: Skill 2.G
tags.description: Skill 2.G: Explain how a text reflects or challenges perceptions of a majority/minority culture.

tags.label: 2.G.i
tags.description: 2.G.i: Distinguish arguments from opinions.

tags.label: 2.G.ii
tags.description: 2.G.ii: Explain how personal beliefs and opinions affect textual interpretation.

tags.label: 2.G.iii
tags.description: 2.G.iii: Make connections between primary and secondary texts.

tags.label: Skill Category 3
tags.description: Skill Category 3: Compare literary texts.

tags.label: Skill 3.A
tags.description: Skill 3.A: Describe structural or stylistic similarities and differences in two texts.

tags.label: 3.A.i
tags.description: 3.A.i: Explain similarities and differences in rhetorical figures.

tags.label: 3.A.ii
tags.description: 3.A.ii: Explain similarities and differences in points of view.

tags.label: 3.A.iii
tags.description: 3.A.iii: Explain similarities and differences in stylistic features.

tags.label: 3.A.iv
tags.description: 3.A.iv: Explain the function of structural features in texts related by period, genre, or theme.

tags.label: 3.A.v
tags.description: 3.A.v: Explain the effect of rhetorical features in texts related by period, genre, or theme.

tags.label: Skill 3.B
tags.description: Skill 3.B: Compare cultural products, practices, or perspectives portrayed in two texts.

tags.label: 3.B.i
tags.description: 3.B.i: Explain how distinct points of view from two literary texts and cultures compare to points of view from their own culture.

tags.label: 3.B.ii
tags.description: 3.B.ii: Explain how representations of cultural product, practices, or perspectives compare to their own literary culture.

tags.label: Skill 3.C
tags.description: Skill 3.C: Identify thematic connections between texts.

tags.label: Skill 3.D
tags.description: Skill 3.D: Compare the development of a theme in two texts.

tags.label: Skill 3.E
tags.description: Skill 3.E: Compare the representation of historical events in two texts.

tags.label: Skill 3.F
tags.description: Skill 3.F: Compare points of view in two texts.

tags.label: Skill Category 4
tags.description: Skill Category 4: Compare a text to artistic representations.

tags.label: Skill 4.A
tags.description: Skill 4.A: Relate texts to practices and perspectives found in a variety of media from the target cultures.

tags.label: 4.A.i
tags.description: 4.A.i: Identify themes and features of artistic representations.

tags.label: 4.A.ii
tags.description: 4.A.ii: Describe similar themes and features between an artistic representation and a literary text.

tags.label: Skill 4.B
tags.description: Skill 4.B: Situate texts within literary and artistic heritages of the target culture.

tags.label: 4.B.i
tags.description: 4.B.i: Explain the significance of similar themes and features found between an artistic representation and a literary text.

tags.label: Skill 4.C
tags.description: Skill 4.C: Describe how a theme is developed in a work of art.

tags.label: Skill Category 5
tags.description: Skill Category 5: Write a literary analysis.

tags.label: Skill 5.A
tags.description: Skill 5.A: Present information in a descriptive form.

tags.label: Skill 5.B
tags.description: Skill 5.B: Create a thesis that states the purpose.

tags.label: Skill 5.C
tags.description: Skill 5.C: Organize information, concepts, and ideas in presentations with a logical and coherent progression of ideas.

tags.label: Skill 5.D
tags.description: Skill 5.D: Elaborate and support main points with textual evidence.

tags.label: Skill 5.E
tags.description: Skill 5.E: Use sources available in the target language to support the interpretation of texts and compare distinct viewpoints.

tags.label: Skill 5.F
tags.description: Skill 5.F: Incorporate information from secondary sources related to texts in oral and written presentations.

tags.label: Skill 5.G
tags.description: Skill 5.G: Use authorized reference materials in oral and written presentations.

tags.label: Skill 5.H
tags.description: Skill 5.H: Acknowledge sources and cite them appropriately.

tags.label: Skill Category 6
tags.description: Skill Category 6: Use accurate language and apply appropriate conventions of written language.

tags.label: Skill 6.A
tags.description: Skill 6.A: Use a variety of vocabulary appropriate to literary analysis.

tags.label: Skill 6.B
tags.description: Skill 6.B: Use a variety of grammatical and syntactic structures.

tags.label: Skill 6.C
tags.description: Skill 6.C: Present and organize information logically.

tags.label: Skill 6.D
tags.description: Skill 6.D: Produce a comprehensible written work by observing writing conventions of the target language.

tags.label: Skill 6.E
tags.description: Skill 6.E: Use a variety of literary and critical terminology in oral and written discussions of texts in the target language.
